CatDescriptText: Robert Jones, 2600 Breckenridge Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that permitting children to work after school hours is detrimental to their general welfare--Health, school, and recreational time, etc?" answer reads: "I think that it's alright because it keeps their minds occupied and out of trouble. I think that it still will allow time for them to do their homework."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert Jones wearing moustache and dark corduroy jacket, standing with hands in pockets against brick wall at bottom of stairs
